citations.narrative:
Female Buff and White Cocker Spaniel #44 has overgrown toenails and matting present on all four feet. The nails on all
four feet are long and curl to the side when examined by the inspector. The hair on all four of the dog's feet is overgrown
and has long pieces (1-2 inches in length) of matted strands of hair hanging from the underside of the feet. The facility
representative states this dog's nails were trimmed and the dog was groomed at the beginning of November 2023, but the
nails still have a lot of growth and matting is present. There is no record of this being completed. The representative
stated they planned to do the trimming and grooming this week.
The program of veterinary care states that long haired dogs will be groomed once a month and clipped as necessary and
toenails will be trimmed once a month. The licensee must follow their preventative care and treatment plans to ensure
healthy and un-matted hair coats, properly trimmed nails, and clean and healthy eyes, ears, skin, and teeth and ensure it
is effective at maintaining healthy husbandry for the dog. The licensee must have this dog's feet groomed to remove all
matting and toenails clipped and ensure they follow their preventative care and treatment plan.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(4)  Repeat
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Female Buff and White Cocker Spaniel #44 has overgrown toenails and matting present on all four feet. The nails on all 
four feet are long and curl to the side when examined by the inspector. The hair on all four of the dog's feet is overgrown 
and has long pieces (1-2 inches in length) of matted strands of hair hanging from the underside of the feet. The facility 
representative states this dog's nails were trimmed and the dog was groomed at the beginning of November 2023, but the 
nails still have a lot of growth and matting is present. There is no record of this being completed. The representative 
stated they planned to do the trimming and grooming this week.  
The program of veterinary care states that long haired dogs will be groomed once a month and clipped as necessary and 
toenails will be trimmed once a month. The licensee must follow their preventative care and treatment plans to ensure 
healthy and un-matted hair coats, properly trimmed nails, and clean and healthy eyes, ears, skin, and teeth and ensure it 
is effective at maintaining healthy husbandry for the dog. The licensee must have this dog's feet groomed to remove all 
matting and toenails clipped and ensure they follow their preventative care and treatment plan. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
